element_texts.text: Completed

Crow Agency
Aug 15/97 Mont
My dear Uncle
I am with the 
Crows yet don't know when
will get away I sent
13 pictures in your care,
to your office hope they
received them all right
I don't want any of them 
unpacked as have them
screwed together so
none of them touch I
have taken to writing
articles for Chicago
newspapers have written
twice for Inter Ocean
and another article 
was written for Inter
Completed

Ocean about the Indians
am painting by a man
here I received a letter
from The Tribune asking
me to write, then something 
now and then wrote 
them 15 pages about
two Indians have painted
White Swan and Chief Deaf
Bull both very noted
Indians so you can read
the article in Tribune
sent to them today.
White Swan has taken
quite a fancy to me, he
was with Reno in
Custer fight and had a 
close call he was left
by the Siouxs for dead
and is the only living
Crow Scout that was 
with Reno he is quite 
an Artist and he is
Completed

(3) painting pictures of his
part in the Custer fight
for me  he gives them to 
me so I invite him
to Dinner with me,  he 
comes before I am up
and commences to work
he is also teaching me
the sign langogue  he has 
to because he is deaf
and nearly dumb from
wounds he received in
the fight.  he had a
picture all finished when
he was on a horse and
has killed a Sioux who
is on another horse  he
has the Sioux falling
from his horse dead
shortly after the picture
was finished a Sioux
Indian came in the 
room (The Siouxs come 
here to visit the Crows
every Summer)  The Sioux
Completed

had also been in the Custer
fight and White Swan
showed him the picture
of the dead Sioux,  it was
laughable to see them
White Swan had the best
of it in the picture but
finally the Sioux reminded
White Swan of his wounds
he has a terrible wound
on his forehead where a
Sioux had struck him 
with a tomy hawk, but
soon White Swan rolled
a cigarette and they both
smoked the same cigarette
The picture am painting 
here beat the Ft Sill pictures
all to peaces,  White Swan
is a great friend of Capt
Scott's,  Capt Scott now
is trying to get him a 
pension.  Tomorrow I
Completed

(5) will have 20 picture
finished.  There is a
Sioux Indian doctor
here by the name of Eastman
you probably know of
him by reputation as
a good deal has been
written of him in the papers
he knows of you and wants
to meet you  he is an educated
man,  at present he is
writing a history of the
Sioux nation from the
Indians standpoint.
the fights they have been
in etc and is going
to get the facts about
the Custer fight that is
the Indians story,  he
came here to talk with
Cheyennes and Crows
who were in it  he came
to my Studio when I
was painting White
Swan to talk with him
through sign language
Completed

he goes to Washington
next month and will
call at your office
to see you.  Today
Sunday I saw another
fine War dance six 
miles from here  it was
interesting to me as some
of the Indians who took
part in it I have painted
If you want any Elk teeth
can get all you want
for 50 cts each from
the Indians they can be
set and made into nice
jewelry.  Just as soon
as get through here will
go to the Cheyenne's 65
miles by wagon then
will go to the Nez
Perces and get Chief
Joseph and Chief Moses
I will get a lot of
Completed

(7) drawings for nothing
out of these Indians
I have things handy
for them in my Studio
and they come in and
loaf around and I
get them to draw something
nearly all of them can 
draw good.
Well I must close
With love to  you
Aunt Emma & Lizzie
Your affectionate
nephew
Elbridge
Completed

Crow Agency
Aug 16/97.   Mont
My dear Uncle
I mailed a letter
to you today but forgot
to speak about the 
portrait of you.  You know
I want to exhibit it
in the coming exhibition
at Art Institute  they
have sent me blanks
to fill out which I
have done and have
written your picture down
I placed the Insurance
at $600.00  The picture
must be there at Art
Institute not later
than Oct 16  They will
Completed

call at your residence
in Chicago for picture
Oct 15th hope it will be
there then I am not
going to exhibit any Indian
picture in Art Institute
will have a private exhibit
at Thurbers expect to
have 40 pictures at least.
have 20 now and have been
gone just two months
today and I will be
gone two more months.
I sent two packages
of pictures to your Office
in Chicago hope they
received them all right
I wrote to Mr Raber
about them to put them
in the safe expect to 
hear from him soon 
that they arrived.
Your affectionate
nephew Elbridge.
Completed

Crow Agency
Aug 21 /97
My dear Uncle
I will leave here
Sept 1st for the Cheyenne's
Have got 23 pictures finished
20 of them are Crows and
all of them very saleable
Have painted two pictures
of White Swan front view
& profile he has made
me several large drawing
colored of the part 
he took in the Custer
fight with Reno all 
of the other Indian
Scouts deserted Reno
except White Swan and 
he stuck by him. he has
got some terrible wounds
Completed

White Swan made me a
present of the drawings
I have a good portrait
of Chief Deaf Bull. The Agent
here has sent for Chief
Plenty Coos who lives
some 80 miles from here
to come here and sit for
me expect him next
week Plenty Coos and
Pretty Eagle are the two
principal Chiefs of the 
Crows. Mr. P. B. Weare
told me to be sure and
get portraits of them
both. After I leave the
Cheyennes will go to 
the Black feet then to
the Flat heads and then
to the Nez Perces I 
dont think I will go
any further West then
Nez Perces as am
told the Indians are
Completed

(3) too much civilized so
I will come back and
stop off with the Pine
Ridge Sioux's dont think
I will be in Chicago
until middle of Nov"
I hav'nt heard yet whether
my picture arrived at your
Office all right or not
I sent 5 Aug 8 and
sent 8 Aug 10 prepaid
the charges and addressed
them to Elbridge Burbank
in your care and Office
address also wrote a
letter with each package
to Mr Raber describing
about the picture to 
put them in the safe
and not to open them
I received a letter
dated Aug 17 from Mr
Raber stating he had
just returned from 10
days vacation
Completed

and as soon as pictures
arrived he would let me 
know and would take
care of them, the pictures
must of been there in the
Office when he wrote
as 9 & 7 days had
passed when he
wrote, so I have written
another letter and
addressed it to the
Office so it will be
opened if Mr Raber is
absent asking about
the pictures I am awfully
anxious about them
as the 13 pictures represent over
$2000.00 and lots of hard
work and the very
best things among them
I intend to paint every
single Indian tribe
in America, this Winter
will spend among the
Completed

Southern Indians have 
thought of going to
San Carlos in Arizona
where the Apache's are
and paint the other Indians
North of there They tell
me there is a tribe of
Indians near Palm beach
Florida called the Seminoles
that the Government could
not get to go to Indian
Territory with the rest of
tribe do you know about
them? The reason have
been staying here so long
is because I can get
such saleable subjects 
among the Indians here 
I could of sold two of
the Indians here to a
Chicago men both
wanted Pretty Eagles
picture but I dont
intend to sell a single
Completed

picture until get to
Chicago and have an
exhibition Would you
like to have White Swan
make you a set of pictures
of his life? He would
make it for $2.00 at
least, they are very
interesting much more so
than what Hawgone
made.
Your affectionate
nephew
Elbridge
Completed

P,S. Enclose send a piece of twig
that Chief Medicine Crow
gave me he said it was
strong medicine.
Crow Agency.
Aug 29/97 Mont.
My Dear Uncle
I received a
letter from Thurber
stating I could have
the last two weeks in
Oct for my exhibition
that the time before
then and after then is
engaged so I will
be in Chicago about
the 10th of Oct. had intended
going to the Cheyennes
this week and from
there to the Black feet
and then to Flat heads
and then to the Nez Perces
but the time is so short
will go this week to
Completed

the Nez Perces have found
out that Chief Joseph
is there sure also Chief
Moses. Yesterday finished
a picture of Plenty Coups
the principal Chief of the
Crows he came 100 miles
by wagon for me and is 
the proudest Indian
ever saw he had his squaw
and an Indian valet to
wait upon him I wrote
an article for Times Herald
about him. he could only
stay two days on account
of a War Dance to be
held 40 miles from here
To day so painted a small
one of him he has the 
handsomest costume ever
saw he said if I would
come to his place he
would sit for a large
one showing full figure
Completed

(3) so this week am to
paint one more Crow then
will go to Billings by
train and from there
will take stage for 30 
miles and go to Plenty
Coups place and paint
a large one of him then
will go direct to the
Nez Perces and remain
the balance of my time.
Capt Watson here is writing
articles on the Indians
for the magazines, at 
present he is writing an
article about Chief
Pretty Eagle, Chief Plenty
Coups and Sharp Nose
and he wanted to use the
paintings I have of Pretty
Eagle and Plenty Coups
for illustrations and Tomorrow
am to paint Sharp Nose
so he can use that
Today Sunday I went
on my wheel to where
Completed

there was three Indians
buried in trees, one of
the bodies had fallen
to the ground so I 
uncovered the blankets
that was wrapped
around it and saw
the body took a photo"
of it. Remington is a
great friend of Capt
Watson's and he is coming
here is a few days to
go hunting and paint
wish I was to be
here but cant. Next
Summer early I am
coming back here and
spend the Summer among
the Siouxs at Pine Ridge
and the Cheyennes Black
feet & Flat heads.
Last Sunday went
hunting and got a lot
of ducks & prairie chickens
Completed

(5)
Think I will sell a
good many of these
pictures am doing
now as they are
way ahead of the others
on account of the costumes
Thurber wrote me that
some parties are waiting
for me to come back to
get some of the pictures
I have now 25 pictures
finished 22 of them are
Crows have one papoose
and one of a girl 8 years
old with an elk tooth
dress on which has 600
elk teeth on it. could of
sold that picture her for
good price but did'nt
care to. Last week I
run across a fellow
Completed

who has traveled 26 years
among the Indians. he 
is writing their history
habits customs etc
says he has 4 editions 
out now every year
he travels among them
showed his some of
my pictures and he
was very enthusiastic
like them very much and
said I had the whole
field to my self and
ought to make a pile 
of money out of it he
said the faces and pictures
as a whole gave one a
better idea than Catlin's
pictures I get along fine
with the Indians several of the
Chiefs want me to live with
them always. If you write
you can address me here Will write
when get to the Nez Perces
with love to all
Your affect" nephew Elbridge
Completed

Billings Mont
Sept 5/97
My dear Uncle
Think I told you
that Chief Plenty Coos drove
100 miles for me to paint
him but he could or
would only stay two
days so I got a small
picture of him he had such
an elegant costume that
I wanted to paint a full
length large one of him so
I went by stage 30 
miles to his place arrived
there last week Friday
and there was a fire in
the mountains ten miles
Completed

away and Plenty Coups
and the rest of Indians
were fighting the fire
he returned Saturday
night all tired out
and this morning Sunday
the fire had started 
again as brisk as ever
and there happened to
be a man there coming
to Billings so I came
with him so got no
portrait of him there
but I ran across
something there which
more than repaid me.
Plenty-Coups has a store
there and so has
another Indian named
No-Milk and they
have a very unique
way of keeping their accounts
Completed

(3)
suppose an Indian by
the name of White Bear
owes them they draw
on a large sheet of paper
or card board a White
bear and place over
or under the picture by 
marks what the Indian
owes, an Indian named
"Old-Yellow woman" they
draw picture of an old
woman and paint it
yellow etc I got four
large sheets covered with
pictures and I got them
in a funny way of course
the Indian would'nt let
the sheet go as it was
all he had to show what
the Indians owed him.
so I borrowed the sheets
and made close
copies of them and
Completed

gave them the copies
and kept the originals
my self. As soon as
all the Indians on 
the sheet square up
then the sheet is burned
up, but I left word
there to send the rest
to me. I leave tonight
for Nez Perces Indians
30 hours ride from here
will stay a month
with them then will go
to Plenty Coups place 
again as am bound
to get a large one of him.
Plenty Coups was awfully
nice to me said he was
very sorry and wanted me
to stay over which would
of done if it had'nt been
for the fire.
With love to all
Am your affect nephew
Elbridge.
Completed

Nes Pilem Wash
(Post Office) Barry Wash
Sept 8/97
My dear Uncle

I left Billings

Sunday night and
have been on the go
ever since and arrived
here this noon Wednesday
This is the most
difficult place you
can imagine to get
to it is 50 miles
from the railroad
and 36 miles of it 
over the roughest
and most dangerous
Completed

road to travel as
had to come in on
the Grand Coulee
and had to cross
the Columbia River
on an Indian ferry
and the last 12 miles
I had to come on 
horse back over
rocks had an Indian
for a guide and
when I arrived found
the most desolate place,
five white men live here and
the questions they asked
me about my self
made me wish I
had'nt come a stranger
does'nt come here once
in two years, it takes
Completed

21 days to get a 
letter to Chicago and 
back. I shall remain
here just long enough
to paint Joseph then
will get out. I have
got to sleep on the
floor I dont have any
milk for my coffee
nor any butter for
bread and wont be
able to get any mail
for at least two 
weeks so will have
my mail sent to 
Spokane and I will
go there. Chief Joseph
lives 3 miles from 
here and he came
to see me this
afternoon had a long
visit with him he
does'nt speak any
Completed

English but had an
interpreter. I told him
about you and gave
him the photograph
taken from your picture 
which pleased him
very much I wrote
on it before him
To Chief Joseph from
Edward E. Ayer he
said he would tack
the pho" on his wall
in his house he is
going to fix up for 
me and will sit
tomorrow if it does'nt
rain he is a fine
looking Indian nice 
pleasant face I had
to laugh to hear him
tell about the
Completed

(5) Brooklyn Bride in
New York he raised
him self up as high as
he could and held his
hand up as high as he
could in describing the
bridge. It is just
luck that Joseph
is here, this is the hop 
picking time and nearly
all the Indians here
go 100 miles to pick
hops Chief Moses
has gone am sorry
as wanted to get
him so there are
very few Indians
here. There are three
kinds here Nez 
Perces, Moses band
of Columbias & Nes 
Pelims. I hardly know
Completed

what to do as
hav'nt money enough
with me to remain
very long as I thought
I would be where
could get a check 
cashed or have money
sent but the only
way it can be sent
is to send the money
in a letter. It cant 
be sent registered
letter as I would 
have to travel 25
miles over a fearful
rock country and
cross the Columbia
to get it and then
it will take 3 weeks
to get a reply to
letter so think the
best thing for me to
Completed

When I arrived here
the people looked at
me as though I came
from some other planet.
At Crow Agency
there is a fine Indian
mummy, one Sunday
I went to where 3 
Indians were buried in
trees and one of the
bodies had fallen to
the ground and it was
all wrapped up I
unwrapped it and
there was a perfect
mummy as hard as
could be with flesh
on. it can be got all 
right. This is the first
time since have been painting
Indians that I wished
right at this moment I was
in Chicago. Your affect
nephew Elbridge.
Completed

(7) do is tu get out of 
this country soon as 
am through with 
Joseph I feel as
though I was in 
Alaska. Last night darkness our took us 
in the Grand Coulee
the rockiest country
even saw their llafherred?
tu be a ranch down 
there and I slept there
that might an old
woman got me some
supper and while I
was eating she sat
on top of the same table and watched
me and after supper
she smoked a pipe.
I was glad tu get
out of there.
see the meat they
have here is rank
9-8-97
Completed

9-12-97

Sunday.
Nis Pilum Wash
P.U. Barry Wach
Sept 12/97
My dear Uncle
I have got 
a splendid portrait 
of Chief Joseph full 
front view he has 
on his fine costume
and I got him to 
paint his face up
in war paint when 
the picture was finished 
Joseph said High as clase.  
Which in Chinook means 
very good He is to sit.
Completed

for me tomorrow for 
a Profile.  I wanted 
him to sit Today Sunday 
and he said. What 
sit on Sunday.  no
me no sit on Sunday. 
Joseph is a fine man?
a perfect gentleman
and very dignified
In fact I have found 
all the Chiefs unclear have
painted fine men and
honorable men. Joseph
lives three miles from
here I went to his
home He lives in 
the most secluded
place has a small
wooden house Two 
rooms in it he has
Completed

(3) 
two squaws has a
nice barn and a good
farm. he has your
picture tacked on
The wall in his front
room, while Joseph
was sitting for me
invited them to eat
with me he has nice
table manners.  I will
have his profile finished
this week Tuesday and 
Wednesday Joseph is
going to take me to 
Wilbur 50 miles by
wagon to where the 
railroad is.  This is 
the most out of the
way and most
difficult place
to get to There are 
four white men? here
9-12-97
Completed

the boss a blacksmith
doctor and miller
only one is married
The others have to do 
Their own cooking, part
of The time they are all
away so I will
cook Dinner for Joseph
and my self. When The 
Indians are all here 
There are some ?
but every one of Them
are away hop picking
except Joseph and
four others who work
around here. There are
Three tribes here Nez
Percer Nes Pilems
and Maria tribe
wish Maria was here
Completed

(5) but he is with his
tribe picking hops
he is an awfully proud
fellow, they say he has
The finest costumes
of an living Indian
The Lourmint? pay (@)
him $1000 a year and his
tribe gets nothing not
even any rations only
implements To farm
with Joseph and his
tribe gets rations
I will mail This 
letter in Wilbur as
it will reach you
quicker There is plenty
of fine painting here
and trout fishing
Will go to Spokane
from here and probably
will go To N. Yakima
where The Indians are

                       9-12-97
Completed

picking hops and get
Maria They tell me
the Nez Pierce reservation 
in Idaho The Indians are
very civilized. The best
time to come here
is in the Winter
as them the Indians
have their dancers and 
are all dressed up 
in dance costume
If you write you can 
address me tu Spokane
Washington care of P.O.
I expect tu be in Chicago
Oct 10 and may be before.
With love tu your and 
Aunt Emma Ann
Your obedient?
nephew? unclear
Completed

P.S.
Monday Sept 13
I will? not be able tu
get another portrait of 
unclear he came around
this afternoon at 4 oclock?
unclear felt tired and did'nt
care tu sit for another
so he is? going tu take me
tu Wilbur 50 miles unclear. Think
I am likely tu have the unclear
and it is me of my hunt?
figures The trouble with 
unclear is he sat for good
he tired him self all out
when I was working in his 
coat he would keep his eyes
exactly in the right place, Told
him he could sleep if he unclear
tu as I was working in the 
coat but he sat just
as careful as though was
Completed

working on his face and he
gave a deep heavy sigh
when the picture was 
finished.
Completed

image--printed font--North Yakima, Wash., -- dashed line Sept 17 1897
My Dear Uncle
I have seen 
Chief Mases and 
the minute I saw him
was pretty sure could'nt
do much with him, he 
is not tu be compared
with Joseph he is mean
and ugly walks around
in a unclear way 
Showed him Josephs
picture which he liked
I had a man talk tu
him who could speak
Nez Perce but he did'nt
care tu sit finally said
if I would give him
$2.50 a day he would
Ayer MS 120
Completed

sit which agreed tu 
Then he said no give
me $3.00 along which
I would to do he
said I had a small 
heart an I would. The 
reason I would' nt is 
this I gave Joseph $2.00
a day and I gave 
Masis $3.00 he would
tell Joseph and all 
the other Indians at 
Nez Pilem and I would 
have tu pay them all the 
same if I did'nt intend
tu visit Nez Pilem
again it would be 
different Another
celebration Nez Perce
Chief is here named 
Ruben wanted his tu 
sit but he would not.
It is a bad time
4218
Completed

decorative font--North Yakima, Wash.,______________________189
tu get them us They 
are picking hops and 
so many Indians
around, it has taught 
me a lesson not tu
try and get Indians
tu sit for me when 
They are away from
thier own reservation
Now I will leave 
tonight for the Cheyenne
Reservation 65 miles from 
the Crows and will
remain their until 
leave for home I
am getting tired of 
chasing after these
Indians The heat place
Ayers MS 120 9-17-97
Completed

tu get the Nez Perces
is at Nes Pilem in 
the Winter some Winter
will go there and will?
get Muses. Muses
is the kind of an Indian
that dais'nt shake
hands he is an two
faced looking man
My address will
be Cheyenne Indian
Reservation via Rosebud
Mont
Your unclear nephew
Eldridge
Completed

Hotel Pedicord
T. J. Pedicord, Proprietor.
Rates: $1.00 to $1.50 Per Day Free Bus and Sample Rooms
209 to 213 Riverside Avenue
Spokane, Wash., Sept 17 1897
My dear Uncle I had a nice time with Joseph he took me to Wilbur 50 miles Joseph speaks Chinook as well as his own language and the Chinook language has quite a number of English words in it. I got me a book in the Chinook language and got so could speak quite a little so we got along fine, on the way we stopped at a fruit farm on the Columbia River and saw the finest fruit ever seen in my life. Pears that weigh 1 1/2 lbs each and the finest peaches we gathered 60 lbs of plumbs from one tree unclear Indians and white men are allowed to help themselves and Joseph and I just stuffed ourselves, on the way Joseph would tell me about the country where he lives in but he doesn't like it
Completed

wants to go back to his old home he calls unclear in Idaho. He told me about the time he was taken to the Injun Territory (as he calls it) said it was a terrible place hotwater to drink hot all the time, said 200 of his people died there some of his children, he had 10 children, all are dead now and he is alone with two squaws,  he told me all about his tribe East this summer what nice things he had to eat (he is a great eater) how nice he was treated etc. he is a fine man and very witty likes to jocke and is quick to see funny things. We arrived in Wilbur late at night so I ordered supper for us unclear and after supper we smoked, in the morning he went to the cars? with me and was sorry to have me go said I must come back in the Winter as then all the Indians are home and they have their dances etc. When I went to Nes Pilem
Completed

I didn't have money enough to stay very long but thought I could send to Chicago and in 10 days anyway would get unclear but it takes 21 days so when arrived here had $1.00 so telegraphed to you for money so would not have to remain here a week to get it. I look a little on the tramp order as are among Indians all the time and squaws do my washing and naturally don't want to wear nice clothes, so wear a flannel shirt and I look tough when I got here I was treated accordingly, never had illustrated before so strongly what a difference clothes make with a man. When I was at Ft Sill I wore good clothes and looked unclear and the
Completed

result was had to[day} the Indians wore for sitting and I wanted to get away Indian brings had to pay well for them Now I get the Indians to sit for 25 cents an hour and I can get things of them for one third I could otherwise.  St Crow Agency  an Artist and his wife were there his name is Ernest Thompson he is an animal and bird Artist you may know him by his magazine name Wolfs head Thompson he illustrates for Century and other magazines and has just published a fine book called Bird life, well when he was at Crows Agency he wanted to buy some Indian things which was the fairest hand work I ever saw made by the Cheyennes the things were completely covered with beads the Indians wanted $15.00 for the lot Mr Thompson was dressed up as he dresses in
Completed

New York and the Indians sized 
him up as having lots of money
I went around with my
trampy appearance and got the
whale lot for $5.00
I will leave here tonight for
N. Yakima where several hundred
Indians are picking {ie[lots]}
there are several Northern Tribes
there including Chief Muses
and most of them have their
costumes with them as they
have dancers etc there they
told me at {[Nes Pilem]} that
Joseph has 5 trunks full
of Indian clothes that he
[wears] Joseph and Moses don't
get along well Moses is
all the time running Joseph
down behind his back and
doing all he can to injure
Completed

him while Joseph never talks
about Moses
I will have my Indian
exhibition at {ie[Thurbur]}
Oct 18 I need the money
all right and am much
obliged. You are about the 
[unclear] correspondent I know
of. I have got four large sheets
of Indians accounts that
I know you will want for 
the Museum and I dare say
no one else has any as
no one else could get them
but an Artist and then he
would have to make close copies
of them in order to get them 
which I did.  If you could see 
that Indians mummy at Crow
Agency you would want it, it
can be got but would have
to be stolen at night as 
the Indians would shoot
any one that he would catch
[unclear] it  When I was
Completed

looking at the mummy two
Indians road up with pistol{ie[s]}
and said to me Sap-e which
means What you want here.  Then
they say You no catch him,

My Dear Uncle
Read letters in regard to my 5. I had six rugs sent to you and wrote you a letter explaining about Them and will send you three more this week If you do not want the large one (the $100.00 one in case you take it alone, but if you take the whole lot it will come awfully cheap)

woven, the body color was Bietta/beyeta? red and the figures were black & white an elegant design about 3x4 but he paid $2.50 for it. If I had seen that Indian alone, Mr Hubbell would never of got it. Of course I have got to be careful here as Mr. Hubbell is very kind to me but I tell you it is an awful temptation to have a chance to lined out: a chance to get the old style rug and not get it, two days ago I saw an old woman Navajo get off from her donkey and there she had a beautiful rug of the Bietta/bayeta? red black & white I bought it for $3.00 and sneaked it into my trunk, but dont think I will do it again as it makes me feel guilty. I have now 10 red style rugs and they cost me $21.00 two of them Mr Hubbell gave me. Mr Hubbell will let you have red rugs on an average of 15.00? each some of them less.

white body tatoos white and little feather tied in his hair.  Monday night I saw the most wierd and curious thing ever saw, on top of the Mesa Dr. Fewkes came out from Washington on purpose to see it  he is connected with the Smithsonian Institute in Washington and knows Mr Holmes very well The Dr has written a few books on the Moquis their dances etc and it was through Dr Femkes & Mr Keams that I was allowed to see the ceremony which takes place on the shortest day of the year and the Moquis can tell it by the rising & setting of the Sun. I wont try to describe the ceremony as it would take too long it lasted all night it took place down in a cave or Keva as it is called

rattles in their hands for music Every one of the other Indians would come down the ladder dressed in the queerest costume and would dance squatted down and then an Indian would make a motion toward the snake and make a speech to which the snake would shake its head and utter the most hideous noise it would do this three times and then a rattling noise would be heard like a rattle snake Moqui squaws would come down and go through queer things some times 15 Indians would come down with some thing in their mouths that made a fearful sounding noise then an Indian would come down dressed as an Eagle he would be completely covered with feathers then another would come down dressed like some animal and that's the way it

My dear Uncle
Your letter recd. I will make another painting of Geronimo the size of the large one of the Pretty Eagles. I am having fair luck here but came near having some serious trouble. I wrote you about the ceremony I witnessed down in the Keva Dec 20 The next day was several Indians in my room and I inquired among them if they know who wore that Eagle costume that night, well you should of seen the confusion and early next morning the head chief of that ceremony
Completed

came to my room and just raised thunder he stormed around and talked in Moqui for half an hour I couldn't understand a word he said but I knew something was the matter that I had done some terrible thing so I got an interpreter and what the old Chief told me scared me he said I had been telling the secrets of what I had seen down in the Keva and that beforehand I had been warmed (which was true) not to tell one thing I saw to a living soul he said that if other Indians who did not belong to the order knew what took place down there that those who did belong to it would all get sick. What I was scared of was that the old chief or some of them would get sick out of
Completed

imagination and no telling what they would do with me but no one got sick and then just before the old Chief left I gave him a package tobacco and a lb of coffee and that seemed to fix it all night, so since then have painted one of the fellows in that queer costume and yesterday the Chief was in to see me and asked me to paint him in the costume he wore that night but the door has to be locked and the windows  fixed so no one can look in. At present am painting a Moqui in full snake dance costume there are 4 different snake costumes and I have got Indians engaged for all four but it is the most sacred costume, they sprinkle the room with sacred meal (corn meal) and when they
Completed

leave sprinkle it in vessels that are in the room and one of the snake dance costumes when I am painting the head that day they eat or drink nothing. These are the finest and most interesting Indians have so far been to and I am liable to be here 3 months I have given of  my trip North this Summer as I will remain here and in the Indians Territory until next Winter I have the Mohavas Zunis Acoma & Apache at San Carlos to go to yet, then the Indian Territory expect to get there some time in July and will remain there until Fall. The Winter is the best time to come for the Moquis as

Expect to leave here in a few days for
